title: SemanGit: A Linked Dataset from git

So it is basically multilayered.
We started with a Git car ontology, modeling the key git functionalities that are provided by Git itself.
For example, commits that can be contributed by an offer, which is according to the Git protocol, just in email address.

Then we introduced an abstraction layer of social features and the reason is that I get providers GitLab, Git app ET C have their own social mechanisms implemented which are technically almost the same, but almost so example for each and everyone of these holsters it's possible to follow other users, whether actual implementation slightly differs.
And as a third layer, we finally introduced the provider specific classes which are annotated, for example with GitHub issue.
For.
Issues that are implemented by GitHub.

From this different classes.
So a GitHub user is inheriting from a Git user, his email property or in GitHub issue is inheriting from the middle layer, it's social features.
